info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 24 at 9:35PM CDT until June 25 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee/Sullivan WI
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Wisconsin...
East Branch Pecatonica River Near Blanchardville affecting Lafayette County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...East Branch Pecatonica River near Blanchardville.
* WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Floodwaters cover a portion of Highway H and floodwaters are into McKellar Park in Blanchardville.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.0 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.0 feet on 06/27/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 945 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON
